author: Staff Reporter
text:
The results of the Common Admission Test (CAT) spelt good news for a few candidates from Bengaluru. With a percentile of 99.94 per cent, Amit M. Warrier (23) managed to bell the CAT in his first attempt.

An alumnus of National Public School, Rajajinagar, he said the test was not a complicated one, as it involved math and English; it was all about getting used to the pace of it. The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Madras graduate wants to pursue MBA to ‘broaden his options’.

Another candidate from the city, Arpit Jain (25), managed a percentile of 99.83. This was his third attempt. The engineering graduate from IIT Roorkee is from Uttar Pradesh. He has been working in Bengaluru for two years. He is preparing to give up his career as a business analyst in an IT firm to realize his IIM dream.
title: Bengaluru’s high performers
